item.title: Bree add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Bree add a quote by Ellen Hopkins
item.description: "Dream Bigger You think. Stop letting small minded people dictate your future when all they really want is for you to accomplish the work of two, for minimum wage. Reach higher, or <b>else</b> plan for retirement in a cardboard box, praying global warming is more than a catchphrase. And if that <b>fails</b> to be the case, hope freezing to death is really as simple as falling asleep, to the lullaby of teeth chatter. <b>Dream bigger</b> before you can't remember how to dream at all." -- Ellen Hopkins

item.title: Bree add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Bree add a quote by Gerald Jampolsky
item.description: "How simple it is to see that all the worry in the world cannot control the future. How simple it is to see that we can only be happy now. And that there will never be a time when it is not now." -- Gerald Jampolsky

item.title: Bree add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Bree add a quote by David McCord
item.description:
"Books Fall Open
Books fall open, you fall in, delighted where, you've never been. Hear voices not once heard before, Reach world through world, through door on door. Find unexpected keys to things, locked up beyond imaginings…. True books will venture, Dare you out, Whisper secrets, Maybe shout, across the gloom, to you in need Who hanker for a book to read." -- David McCord

item.title: Bree add a quote by Terry McMillan
item.description: "Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do." -- Terry McMillan

item.title: Bree add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Maybe our favorite quotations say more about us than about the stories and people we're quoting." -- John Green

item.title: Bree add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Bree add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Bree add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Bree add a quote by Jennifer E. Smith
Bree add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Bree add a quote by Maria Montessori
item.description: "Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create." -- Maria Montessori

item.title: Bree add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Bree add a quote by Anthony Powell
item.description: "I get a warm feeling among my books." -- Anthony Powell

item.title: Bree add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "The book is a film that takes place in the mind of the reader. That's why we go to movies and say, "Oh, the book is better." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Bree add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes...you're Doing Something." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Bree add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "Books fall open, you fall in. When you climb out again, you're a bit larger than you used to be." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Bree add a quote by Keri Hulme
item.description: "You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read..." -- Keri Hulme
